item.title: Google’s Willow Chip Signals the Urgency of Post-Quantum Cryptography Migration
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Google’s Willow quantum chip marks a transformative moment in quantum computing development.

The post Google’s Willow Chip Signals the Urgency of Post-Quantum Cryptography Migration appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of December 9, 2024 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of December 9, 2024. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: 446,000 Impacted by Center for Vein Restoration Data Breach
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Center for Vein Restoration discloses data breach impacting the personal, medical, and financial information of 446,000 individuals.

The post 446,000 Impacted by Center for Vein Restoration Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ICS Patch Tuesday: Security Advisories Released by Siemens, Schneider, CISA, Others
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
December 2024 ICS Patch Tuesday brings advisories from CISA, as well as several major industrial automation companies. 

The post ICS Patch Tuesday: Security Advisories Released by Siemens, Schneider, CISA, Others appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Ivanti Patches Critical Flaws in Connect Secure, Cloud Services Application
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Ivanti has released patches for critical vulnerabilities in Cloud Services Application, Connect Secure, and Policy Secure.

The post Ivanti Patches Critical Flaws in Connect Secure, Cloud Services Application appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: US Charges, Sanctions Chinese Man Accused of Sophos Firewall Hacking
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
The US government announced charges, sanctions and a reward for Guan Tianfeng, a Chinese national accused of involvement in Sophos firewall hacks.

The post US Charges, Sanctions Chinese Man Accused of Sophos Firewall Hacking appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Microsoft Ships Urgent Patch for Exploited Windows CLFS Zero-Day
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Patch Tuesday: Redmond patches 71 security flaws and calls immediate attention to an exploited Windows zero-day reported by CrowdStrike.

The post Microsoft Ships Urgent Patch for Exploited Windows CLFS Zero-Day appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Adobe Patches Over 160 Vulnerabilities Across 16 Products
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Adobe has patched over 160 vulnerabilities across over a dozen products, including Reader, Illustrator, Photoshop and Connect.

The post Adobe Patches Over 160 Vulnerabilities Across 16 Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Wald.ai Raises $4M in Seed Funding to Protect Data in Conversations With AI Assistants
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Wald.ai has raised $4 million in seed funding for a solution designed to ensure data protection when organizations use AI assistants.

The post Wald.ai Raises $4M in Seed Funding to Protect Data in Conversations With AI Assistants appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cleo File Transfer Tool Vulnerability Exploited in Wild Against Enterprises
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
CVE-2024-50623, an improperly patched vulnerability affecting Cleo file transfer tools, has been exploited in the wild.

The post Cleo File Transfer Tool Vulnerability Exploited in Wild Against Enterprises appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: SAP Patches Critical Vulnerability in NetWeaver
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
SAP has released patches for 16 vulnerabilities, including a critical-severity SSRF bug in NetWeaver (Adobe Document Services).

The post SAP Patches Critical Vulnerability in NetWeaver appeared first on SecurityWeek.
